Posts.Content: On Dec 26, 2014 2:31 AM sandylee1999 wrote: On Oct 22, 2014 11:37 PM janr888 wrote:  hi ,    I asked about that , I wanted to get a double masectomy just to be safe .  I was told I had no more chance of  getting cancer in the other breast then I would have if I had never been diagnosised with breast cancer at all . this is all so hard .   Who did you talk to? I should have had it done the first time and now that it's back in the other breast, I really wish I had. So live and learn, Hi Sandylee, No need to stress about whether you did the mastectomy back then or not.  I had the mastectomy, chemo, and 33 radiation treatments and delayed reconstruction. I did everything the onc recommeded to avoid a reoccurance.  I was cancer free for 3 1/2 years and found a lump in my next 3 weeks ago.  Hat a CT Scan and found 3 cancerous tumors in the lymph nodes above and below the clavical, and many lung mets.  The even radiated the lymph nodes!!  But still...it came back.  I seen women who did the most aggressive chemo..."the red devil" and it still comes back. I'm scared of chemo now because all the articles on the immune system. Chemo depletes the immune system allowing the cancer to grow and spread.  I am currently on Arimidex, but am going to MD Anderson to try anything possible.  I don't want to stand by and take the hormonals and maintain..until it stops working, then move on to the next and the next..  I want to give myself the best fighting chance I have.  I know stage 4 is not curable, but I plan to fight this for a very long time! Hugs, Robin
